message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and ECG findings suggest that the patient has a history of anxiety but may also have preexisting heart disease that was unmasked by the lorazepam. Electrophysiological studies can help identify any underlying cardiac abnormalities and guide further management. Cardiac catheterization is not indicated based on the current information. No further management is not appropriate as the patient has a significant medical history and abnormal ECG findings. Sodium bicarbonate is not indicated in this scenario.

Electrophysiological studies can help diagnose and determine the appropriate treatment plan. Cardiac catheterization and sodium bicarbonate are not appropriate treatments for this issue, and no further management is not appropriate given the potential seriousness of cardiac conduction abnormalities.
